ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a greater understanding of the structure, rules, and complexities to Congress.
The course provided detailed insight into the politics of the United States government and provided grounds for critical thinking about the way the American system functions.

Lots of insight into the operation and constraints surrounding the US Congress. Lots of constitutional discussion, which I found particularly interesting. Class discussion was lively and related to lectures and readings.

This course was a broad, introductory survey to the inner workings of Congress and how it functions as a body  very much a "Congress 101" class. It provided me with some base knowledge about Congress that I did not have previously. Additionally, we got a little bit into some debates about how Congress could potentially be improved or altered to become more effective.
I increased my knowledge of the most important branch of government.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: 1) The course is what is says on the tin: a course on Congress 2) workload is manageable and fair 3) You get out what you put in
The way the course was designed, between in-class discussions  and the opportunity to be discussion leader on a chosen topic was definitely a strength of the course.

Strengths: Well-structured with an engaging TA and Professor. It was clear they were passionate about the subject, and made the material more interesting to learn. Workload was manageable overall, and readings werent overwhelming. If youre at all interested in Congress/US Politics, this is a great intro course!

Weaknesses: The summer class schedule made assignments have a very quick turnaround; if you have family engagements or a summer internship it can be quite difficult to write a well-structured paper in 48 hours. Not a huge deal whatsoever, though just make sure to manage your time well!

Prof. Fairdosi and our TF, Ramon, were both very knowledgeable and engaged with the class. It was fun to learn from them. The biggest weakness was probably that the class was somewhat split in that half the class was quite engaged, while the other half was not. This meant that a lot of the same people ended up speaking much of the time, which might have decreased the variety of perspectives that we could have gotten if everyone had been more engaged.
No need to improve

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend to someone that wanted to learn about Congress and American politics. It is an approachable course even if you do not have a background in US government/are not from the US.
I definitely would. The class is structured so that there is always positive and sharing of ideas in a positive environment..
Yes.  Class was very engaging and will enhance your knowledge of the ins and outs of Congress.
Absolutelymakes a great gut course for majors, and a well-structured intro to politics/congress for non-majors. Engaging and interesting overall!

I would recommend this course to a student looking for an introduction to Congress, but not a deeply philosophical or introspective look at Congress. The meat of this course is at the surface/knowledge level, with a dip but not a dive into deeper learning.

I highly recommend this course to any student looking for a comprehensive, introductory course on the US Congress and a highly-engaging political science course to take in the summer. Professor Fairdosi makes a really strong effort to make the course engaging even online and the discussions we had we always enriching, especially because we had multiple people who had strong experience working for Congress. Ramon, the TA, was extremely knowledgeable and keen to provide key insights into the discussion. The feedback for the essays was extremely clear as well. Thank you for an amazing summer course!
Yes

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
comments: Neutral
Strongly Agree

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: The knowledge and skills will be incredibly useful to my future career endeavours within US government.
I am hoping to pursue a career in the military, then perhaps government in the future.
Certainly, the basic literacy I gained about Congress and how Congress works would serve me well if I had any interest in going into politics or government.

The class was extremely helpful to provide a comparative study on the US Congress since I work extensively in the Philippine Congress. Even the insights in the course can be applied to the Philippines, so I look forward to see how the insights in the course can enrich my work there.
N/A
